rename.to: -webkit-app-region: drag prevents clicks on overlapping browser view

body:
I filed this because we have an issue where a browser view will stop responding to click events.
Digging into it further, I think this is because the browser view can `UpdateDraggableRegions` if it's not currently in the window.

For example, if
1. the `app-region: drag` div is behind a browser view and has 100px height
2. switch to a second browser view
3. change the `app-region: drag` div to have 10px height
4. switch back to the first browser view

Than the first browser view will still not respond to click as if the drag region was 100px, even though it is now actually 10px.

I did a manual bisect of the issue using @ibash's very helpful repository, and it looks like it's existed as long as `app-region: drag` was supported by `BrowserView`. I was able to reproduce on 1.7.7, but not 1.7.6 (which makes sense, because I don't think `app-region: drag` was supported for browser views before 1.7.7
/cc @felixrieseberg I think you did the magic to support dragging ðŸ˜„
@ibash Thanks for reporting this! I'll work on a fix.

issue.title: Update draggable regions when changing BrowserView

repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.body:
This PR is best reviewed by looking at each individual commit.

This should be cherry-picked to `2-0-x`, but it will require a separate PR due to conflicts.

Fixes #12150.
